title: Authors and Citation
text: Igor Dornelles Schoeller Siciliani. Author, maintainer. Paulo Henrique dos Santos. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dornelles Schoeller Siciliani , Henrique dos Santos P (2024). corrp: Compute Correlations Type Analysis Parallel. https://github.com/meantrix/corrp, https://meantrix.github.io/corrp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {corrp: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel},   author = {Igor {Dornelles Schoeller Siciliani} and Paulo {Henrique dos Santos}},   year = {2024},   note = {https://github.com/meantrix/corrp, https://meantrix.github.io/corrp/}, }

what: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: Compute multiple types correlation analysis (Pearson correlation, R^2 coefficient linear regression, Cramer’s V measure association, Distance Correlation, Maximal Information Coefficient, Uncertainty coefficient Predictive Power Score) large dataframes mixed columns classes(integer, numeric, factor character) parallel R backend. package also C++ implementation Average correlation clustering algorithm ACCA works directly correlation matrix. sense, implementation differs original, works mixed data several correlation types methods.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: corrp package development Meantrix team original based Srikanth KS (talegari) cor2 function can provide R users way work correlation analysis among large data.frames, tibbles data.tables R parallel backend C++ functions. data.frame allowed columns four classes: integer, numeric, factor character. character column considered categorical variable. new package correlation automatically computed according follow options:

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: Pearson correlation test ; Distance Correlation; Maximal Information Coefficient; Predictive Power Score.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: correlation coefficient squared root R^2 coefficient linear regression; Predictive Power Score.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: cramersV measure association two nominal .; Uncertainty coefficient. Predictive Power Score. Also, statistical tests controlled significance p.value param. statistical tests obtain significance greater/less p.value, default output variable isig FALSE. statistical significance test pps algorithm, isig = TRUE case. errors occur operations default correlation NA.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: begin, ensure met following requirement(s): R >= 3.6.2 installed. Install development version GitHub:

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: corrp package provides seven main functions correlation calculations, clustering basic data manipulation: corrp, corr_fun, corr_matrix, corr_rm, acca , sil_acca best_acca. corrp Next, calculate correlations data set iris using: Maximal Information Coefficient numeric pair, Power Predictive Score algorithm numeric/categorical pair Uncertainty coefficient categorical pair. corr_matrix Using previous result can create correlation matrix follows: Now, can clustering data set variables ACCA correlation matrix. way example, consider 2 clusters k = 2: Also,can calculate average silhouette width cluster acca.res: Observations large average silhouette width (almost 1) well clustered.
code: results = corrp::corrp(iris, cor.nn = 'mic',cor.nc = 'pps',cor.cc = 'uncoef', n.cores = 2 , verbose = FALSE)  head(results$data) #                            infer infer.value        stat stat.value isig msg         varx         vary # Maximal Information Coefficient   0.9994870     P-value  0.0000000 TRUE     Sepal.Length Sepal.Length # Maximal Information Coefficient   0.2770503     P-value  0.0000000 TRUE     Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width # Maximal Information Coefficient   0.7682996     P-value  0.0000000 TRUE     Sepal.Length Petal.Length # Maximal Information Coefficient   0.6683281     P-value  0.0000000 TRUE     Sepal.Length  Petal.Width #          Predictive Power Score   0.5591864 F1_weighted  0.7028029 TRUE     Sepal.Length      Species # Maximal Information Coefficient   0.2770503     P-value  0.0000000 TRUE      Sepal.Width Sepal.Length m = corr_matrix(results,col = 'infer.value',isig = TRUE) m #              Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width   Species # Sepal.Length    0.9994870   0.2770503    0.7682996   0.6683281 0.4075487 # Sepal.Width     0.2770503   0.9967831    0.4391362   0.4354146 0.2012876 # Petal.Length    0.7682996   0.4391362    1.0000000   0.9182958 0.7904907 # Petal.Width     0.6683281   0.4354146    0.9182958   0.9995144 0.7561113 # Species         0.5591864   0.3134401    0.9167580   0.9398532 0.9999758 # attr(,"class") # [1] "cmatrix" "matrix" acca.res = acca(m,2) acca.res # $cluster1 # [1] "Species"      "Sepal.Length" "Petal.Width"  #  # $cluster2 # [1] "Petal.Length" "Sepal.Width"  #  # attr(,"class") # [1] "acca_list" "list" sil_acca(acca.res,m) # [1] -0.02831006 # attr(,"class") # [1] "corrpstat" # attr(,"statistic") # [1] "Silhouette"

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: contribute corrp, follow steps: Fork repository. Create branch: git checkout -b <branch_name>. Make changes commit : git commit -m '<commit_message>' Push original branch: git push origin corrp/<location> Create pull request. Alternatively see GitHub documentation creating pull request.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: detected bug (want ask new feature), please file issue minimal reproducible example GitHub.

title: Compute Correlations Type Analysis in Parallel
text: project uses following license: GLP3 License.

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
text: C++ implementation ACCA method works directly correlation matrix derived corr_matrix function. sense, implementation differs original, works mixed data several correlation methods.

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
code: acca(m, ...)  # S3 method for cmatrix acca(m, k, maxrep = 2L, maxiter = 100L, ...)  # S3 method for matrix acca(m, k, maxrep = 2L, maxiter = 100L, ...)

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
text: m \[matrix(1)] correlation matrix corr_matrix distance matrix. ... Additional arguments (TODO). k \[integer(1)] number clusters considered. maxrep \[integer(1)] maximum number interactions without change clusters. maxiter \[integer(1)] maximum number interactions.

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
text: \[acca_list(k)] list final result clustering method.  , name variables belonging cluster k.

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
text: Bhattacharya, Anindya, Rajat K. De. "Average correlation clustering algorithm (ACCA) grouping co-regulated genes similar pattern variation expression values." Journal Biomedical Informatics 43.4 (2010): 560-568.

title: Average correlation clustering algorithm — acca
text: Igor D.S. Siciliani

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
text: Determining optimal number cluster ACCA clustering using average silhouette aproach.

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
code: best_acca(m, ...)  # S3 method for cmatrix best_acca(m, mink, maxk, maxrep = 2L, maxiter = 100L, ...)  # S3 method for matrix best_acca(m, mink, maxk, maxrep = 2L, maxiter = 100L, ...)

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
text: m \[matrix(1)] correlation matrix corr_matrix. ... Additional arguments (TODO). mink \[integer(1)] minimum number clusters considered. maxk \[integer(1)] maximum number clusters considered. maxrep \[integer(1)] maximum number interactions without change clusters ACCA method. maxiter \[integer(1)] maximum number interactions ACCA method.

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
text: \[list(3)] list : silhouette average per k `$silhouette.ave`; sequence clusters tested `$k` optimal number clusters `$best.k`.

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
text: Leonard Kaufman; Peter J. Rousseeuw (1990). Finding groups data : introduction cluster analysis. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley-Interscience. p. 87. doi:10.1002/9780470316801. ISBN 9780471878766. Starczewski, Artur, Adam Krzyżak. "Performance evaluation silhouette index. "International Conference Artificial Intelligence Soft Computing. Springer, Cham, 2015.

title: Silhouette (clustering) — best_acca
text: Igor D.S. Siciliani

what: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: Compute correlation type analysis two mixed classes columns given dataframe.   dataframe allowed columns four classes: integer,   numeric, factor character. character column considered   categorical variable.

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
code: corr_fun(   df,   nx,   ny,   p.value = 0.05,   verbose = TRUE,   num.s = 1000,   rk = FALSE,   comp = c("greater", "less"),   alternative = c("two.sided", "less", "greater"),   cor.nn = c("pearson", "mic", "dcor", "pps"),   cor.nc = c("lm", "pps"),   cor.cc = c("cramersV", "uncoef", "pps"),   lm.args = list(),   pearson.args = list(),   dcor.args = list(),   mic.args = list(),   pps.args = list(),   cramersV.args = list(),   uncoef.args = list(),   ... )

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: df \[data.frame(1)] input data frame. nx \[character(1)] column name  independent/predictor variable. ny \[character(1)] column name dependent/target variable. p.value \[logical(1)] P-value probability obtaining observed results test, assuming null hypothesis correct. default p.value=0.05 (Cutoff value p-value.). verbose \[logical(1)] Activate verbose mode. num.s \[numeric(1)] Used permutation test. number samples replacement created y numeric vector. rk \[logical(1)] Used permutation test. TRUE transform x, y numeric vectors samples ranks. comp \[character(1)] param p.value must greater less estimated tests correlations. alternative \[character(1)] character string specifying alternative hypothesis correlation inference. must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less". can specify just initial letter. cor.nn \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used integer/numeric pair inference. options `pearson: Pearson Correlation`,`mic: Maximal Information Coefficient`, `dcor: Distance Correlation`,`pps: Predictive Power Score`.Default `Pearson Correlation`. cor.nc \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair inference. option `lm: Linear Model`,`pps: Predictive Power Score`. Default `Linear Model`. cor.cc \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used factor/categorical pair inference. option `cramersV: Cramer's V`,`uncoef: Uncertainty coefficient`, `pps: Predictive Power Score`. Default ` Cramer's V`. lm.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. pearson.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. dcor.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. mic.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. pps.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. cramersV.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. uncoef.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. ... Additional arguments (TODO).

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: list statistical results. - statistical tests controlled confidence internal   p.value param. statistical tests  obtain significance greater/less   p.value value variable `isig` `FALSE`. - statistical significance test  pps algorithm. default `isig` TRUE. - errors occur operations  default association measure(`infer.value`) `NA`.

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: - integer/numeric pair Pearson Correlation using cor function.   value lies -1 1. - integer/numeric pair Distance Correlation using dcorT.test function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric pair Maximal Information Coefficient using mine function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric pair Predictive Power Score using  score function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair correlation coefficient   squared root R^2 coefficient linear regression integer/numeric   variable factor/categorical variable using  lm function. value   lies 0 1. - integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair  Predictive Power Score using score function.  value lies 0 1. - factor/categorical pair Cramer's V value   computed based chisq test using  cramersV function. value lies   0 1. - factor/categorical pair Uncertainty coefficient  using UncertCoef function.   value lies 0 1. - factor/categorical pair Predictive Power Score  using score function.  value lies 0 1.

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: KS Srikanth,sidekicks,cor2, 2020. URL https://github.com/talegari/sidekicks/. Paul van der Laken, ppsr,2021. URL https://github.com/paulvanderlaken/ppsr.

title: Compute Correlation type analysis with Statistical Significance — corr_fun
text: Igor D.S. Siciliani

what: Create Correlation Matrix from corrp inferences — corr_matrix
title: Create Correlation Matrix from corrp inferences — corr_matrix
text: results obtained corrp function create correlation matrix.

title: Create Correlation Matrix from corrp inferences — corr_matrix
code: corr_matrix(c, ...)  # S3 method for default corr_matrix(c, col = c("infer.value", "stat.value", "isig"), isig = TRUE, ...)  # S3 method for clist corr_matrix(c, col = c("infer.value", "stat.value", "isig"), isig = TRUE, ...)

title: Create Correlation Matrix from corrp inferences — corr_matrix
text: c \[corrp.list(1)] output corrp function. ... Additional arguments (TODO). col \[character(1)] choose column used correlation matrix. isig \[logical(1)] values statistically significant represented NA FALSE correlation matrix.

title: Create Correlation Matrix from corrp inferences — corr_matrix
text: Igor D.S. Siciliani

what: corr_rm filter data.frame by correlation values. — corr_rm
title: corr_rm filter data.frame by correlation values. — corr_rm
text: Remove highly correlated variables data.frame using corrp functions outputs caret package function findCorrelation.

title: corr_rm filter data.frame by correlation values. — corr_rm
code: corr_rm(df, c, ...)  # S3 method for clist corr_rm(   df,   c,   col = c("infer.value", "stat.value"),   isig = TRUE,   cutoff = 0.75,   ... )  # S3 method for list corr_rm(   df,   c,   col = c("infer.value", "stat.value"),   isig = TRUE,   cutoff = 0.75,   ... )  # S3 method for cmatrix corr_rm(df, c, cutoff = 0.75, ...)  # S3 method for matrix corr_rm(df, c, cutoff = 0.75, ...)

title: corr_rm filter data.frame by correlation values. — corr_rm
text: df \[data.frame(1)] input data frame. c \[clist(1) | cmatrix(1)] correlation list  output corrp correlation matrix output corr_matrix. ... Additional arguments (TODO). col \[character(1)] choose column used correlation matrix isig \[logical(1)] values statistically significant represented NA FALSE correlation matrix. cutoff \[numeric(1)] numeric value pair-wise absolute correlation cutoff. default values 0.75.

what: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
title: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
text: Compute correlations type analysis mixed classes columns larges dataframes parallel backend. dataframe allowed columns four classes: integer, numeric, factor character. character column considered categorical variable.

title: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
code: corrp(   df,   parallel = TRUE,   n.cores = 1,   p.value = 0.05,   verbose = TRUE,   num.s = 1000,   rk = FALSE,   comp = c("greater", "less"),   alternative = c("two.sided", "less", "greater"),   cor.nn = c("pearson", "mic", "dcor", "pps"),   cor.nc = c("lm", "pps"),   cor.cc = c("cramersV", "uncoef", "pps"),   lm.args = list(),   pearson.args = list(),   dcor.args = list(),   mic.args = list(),   pps.args = list(),   cramersV.args = list(),   uncoef.args = list(),   ... )

title: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
text: df \[data.frame(1)] input data frame. parallel \[logical(1)] TRUE run operations parallel backend. n.cores \[numeric(1)] number cores use parallel execution. p.value \[logical(1)] P-value probability obtaining observed results test, assuming null hypothesis correct. default p.value=0.05 (Cutoff value p-value.). verbose \[logical(1)] Activate verbose mode. num.s \[numeric(1)] Used permutation test. number samples replacement created y numeric vector. rk \[logical(1)] Used permutation test. TRUE transform x, y numeric vectors samples ranks. comp \[character(1)] param p.value must greater less estimated tests correlations. alternative \[character(1)] character string specifying alternative hypothesis correlation inference. must one "two.sided" (default), "greater" "less". can specify just initial letter. cor.nn \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used integer/numeric pair inference. options `pearson: Pearson Correlation`,`mic: Maximal Information Coefficient`, `dcor: Distance Correlation`,`pps: Predictive Power Score`.Default `Pearson Correlation`. cor.nc \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair inference. option `lm: Linear Model`,`pps: Predictive Power Score`. Default `Linear Model`. cor.cc \[character(1)] Choose correlation type used factor/categorical pair inference. option `cramersV: Cramer's V`,`uncoef: Uncertainty coefficient`, `pps: Predictive Power Score`. Default ` Cramer's V`. lm.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. pearson.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. dcor.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. mic.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. pps.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. cramersV.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. uncoef.args \[list(1)] additional parameters specific method. ... Additional arguments (TODO).

title: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
text: list two tables: data index. - `$data` table contains statistical results; - `$index` table contains pairs indices used inference data table. - statistical tests controlled confidence internal   p.value param. statistical tests obtain significance greater/less   p.value value variable `isig` `FALSE`. - statistical significance test pps algorithm. default `isig` TRUE. - errors occur operations association measure(`infer.value`) `NA`.

title: corrp compute correlations types analysis in parallel backend. — corrp
text: - integer/numeric pair Pearson Correlation using cor function.   value lies -1 1. - integer/numeric pair Distance Correlation using dcorT.test function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric pair Maximal Information Coefficient using mine function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric pair Predictive Power Score using score function.   value lies 0 1. - integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair correlation coefficient   squared root R^2 coefficient linear regression integer/numeric   variable factor/categorical variable using lm function. value   lies 0 1. - integer/numeric - factor/categorical pair Predictive Power Score using score function.   value lies 0 1. - factor/categorical pair Cramer's V value   computed based chisq test using cramersV function. value lies   0 1. - factor/categorical pair Uncertainty coefficient using UncertCoef function.   value lies 0 1. - factor/categorical pair Predictive Power Score using score function.   value lies 0 1.

title: Correlation permutation test — ptest
